, Burnham Market is a busy and very large village attracting many tourists throughout the year.
Burnham Market is home to many local businesses and is served well by major local routes.
Burnham market is one of the five Norfolk Burnhams in existence today. There were originally seven, but Burnham Market is the merger of three villages:

The two churches of the three villages remain and are still in use.
is the former Burnham Westgate Church and
is the Church of both Burnham Sutton and Burnham Ulph. Now, both Churches are in the Civil Parish of Burnham Market.

although many services through Burnham Market terminate at nearby
. The Coasthopper bus is an all year round bus service serving the North Norfolk Coastline, and can provide access into Burnham Market from many North Norfolk locations.

Unfortunately, there are few other bus services in Burnham Market. From Fakenham, the
29 service goes to Wells, where the Coasthopper bus can be used.

The B1105 and B1355 roads both run through Burnham Market.

- You may also use the B1105 from the A149.

Annually there is a popular craft which takes over the entire village and a wonderfully festive atmosphere when everyone turns out to see a new celebrity each year as he or she turns on the Christmas lights.

Burnham Market  not only has a traditional post office, butcher, baker, hardware shop, fish shop and chemist for all the necessities of everyday life, but also has over 30 highly original independent and specialist shops. Beauty salons and galleries, selling a wide range of exciting deli products, vibrant and stylish accessories for home and garden, paintings, prints and unique coastal artworks,trendy and traditional clothes for all the family, and books old and new.
The village has many food outlets including traditional bakeries and cafés. Most of these outlets are nearby the village green in the centre of Burnham Market.

content=A nationally acclaimed Hotel which takes centre stage overlooking the village green. It offers a range of wonderful restaurants, bar, beauty spa and 58 bedrooms across six properties which include the main hotel, a small and charming boutique hotel across the village green and a converted railway house.
